titleStmt.title: Co G, 2nd Regt, Kentucky State Guard

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: Co G, 2nd Regt, Kentucky State Guard

body.p: Named the "Buckner Grays" in honor of General Simon Bolivar Buckner, and was sworn into Confederate service at Camp Niccols, eight miles north of Franklin, Tennessee in September 1861. Originally part of the Louisville Battalion, commanded by Colonel Thomas H. Hunt, the 2nd regiment would become part of the First Kentucky Brigade, the famed "Orphan Brigade" soon after being mustered into Confederate service.

ab.bibl: Perrin, Coulter, Harrison, Louisville Daily Courier, April 24th and May 13th, 1861. Thompsan, History of the Orphan Birgade. Grainger, Four Years With The Boys in Gray.
